question:
There is a public park near where you live. You have heard that the local council wants to sell this park.


Write a letter to a local newspaper. In your letter:


introduce yourself
describe the importance of the park
say what action you will take if the council continues with its plan
text: My given names are Antony Peter, and I am writing to express my dissatisfaction with the British local council's decision, after watching a video on news.com, about the national park selling.

Unfortunately, the city has been less green than ever before and destroying the National Park would be minimizing dramatically part of the existing environment areas we have there. Furthermore, people might not find places to have some fun with their family members, especially those who are household and disabled.

I thereby will be contacting any institutions that may handle deforestation cases. Moreover, reaching out to the government can also supports in not enabling this plan to take place. I look forward to hearing from you soon.
